<ce:section-title id="st040">Preparation of the model compounds</ce:section-title><ce:para id="p0045" view="all">[CoL(H<ce:inf loc="post">2</ce:inf>O)]·2H<ce:inf loc="post">2</ce:inf>O (<ce:bold>1</ce:bold>) Co(NO<ce:inf loc="post">3</ce:inf>)<ce:inf loc="post">2</ce:inf>·6H<ce:inf loc="post">2</ce:inf>O (0.0588 g, 0.2 mmol), L (0.0543 g, 0.3 mmol) and TMC (0.0265 g, 0.1 mmol) were dissolved in a mixed solution of 3 mL EtOH, 1 mL H<ce:inf loc="post">2</ce:inf>O and 1 mL DMF. The pH of the solution was adjusted with dilute nitric acid to make the pH equal to 5. The solution is stirred for 2 h at room temperature to give a pink suspension, which was transferred to a reaction pyrex vial and heated at 120 °C for 5 days. After cooled to room temperature, pink bulk crystals were obtained. Yield: 0.046 g; 41% (based on Co (II)). Calc. for C<ce:inf loc="post">8</ce:inf>H<ce:inf loc="post">10</ce:inf>NO<ce:inf loc="post">7</ce:inf>Co: C, 32.59; H, 4.39; N, 4.81. Found: C, 32.64; H, 4.42; N, 4.76%. IR (KBr, cm<ce:sup loc="post">−1</ce:sup>): 3427, 3221, 3275, 2926, 2869, 1620, 1563, 1417, 1335, 1131, 1099, 1037, 783.</ce:para><ce:para id="p0050" view="all">[CdL(H<ce:inf loc="post">2</ce:inf>O)]·H<ce:inf loc="post">2</ce:inf>O (<ce:bold>2</ce:bold>) Cd(NO<ce:inf loc="post">3</ce:inf>)<ce:inf loc="post">2</ce:inf>·6H<ce:inf loc="post">2</ce:inf>O (0.0588 g, 0.2 mmol), L (0.0543 g, 0.3 mmol) and TMC (Trimesoyl chloride) (0.0265 g, 0.1 mmol) were dissolved in a mixed solution of 4 mL EtOH, 1 mL H<ce:inf loc="post">2</ce:inf>O and 2 mL DMF. To adjust the pH of the solution with dilute nitric acid so that pH equal to 4. Stirring at room temperature for 2 h, a colorless transparent solution is obtained. Transfer the solution to a heat-resistant vial and heated at 140 °C for 2 days. After cooled to room temperature, colorless crystals were obtained. Yield: 0.054 g; 39% (based on Cd (II)). Calc. for C<ce:inf loc="post">8</ce:inf>H<ce:inf loc="post">9</ce:inf>NO<ce:inf loc="post">6</ce:inf>Cd: C, 29.32; H, 2.69; N, 4.31. Found: C, 29.31; H, 2.75; N, 4.27%. IR (KBr, cm<ce:sup loc="post">−1</ce:sup>): 3336, 3216, 3139, 2920, 2861, 1617, 1549, 1476, 1383, 1153, 1066, 1014, 780.</ce:para><ce:para id="p0055" view="all">[PbL] (<ce:bold>3</ce:bold>) PbSO<ce:inf loc="post">4</ce:inf> (0.0304 g, 0.1 mmol) and L (0.0362 g, 0.2 mmol) were dissolved in a mixed solution of 2 mL EtOH and 3 mL DMA. Stirring at room temperature for 2 h to give a white suspension, which was transferred to a Teflon-lined steel autoclave and heated at 120 °C for 4 days. After cooled to room temperature, colorless block crystals were obtained. Yield: 0.019 g; 28% (based on Pb (II)). Calc. for C<ce:inf loc="post">8</ce:inf>H<ce:inf loc="post">5</ce:inf>NO<ce:inf loc="post">4</ce:inf>Pb: C, 24.82; H, 1.79; N, 3.65. Found: C, 24.85; H, 1.81; N, 3.62%. IR (KBr, cm<ce:sup loc="post">−1</ce:sup>): 3423, 3292, 3110, 2944, 2853, 1637, 1569, 1454, 1389, 1123, 1064, 1012, 778.</ce:para><ce:section-title id="st050">Antioxidant activity measurement</ce:section-title><ce:section-title id="st055">Solution preparation</ce:section-title><ce:para id="p0065" view="all">Preparation of Tris solution (0.1 mol/L): Weigh 1.2114 g of tris-hydroxymethyl aminomethane (Tris) in a beaker and dilute to 100 mL with double distilled water. Preparation of hydrochloric acid solution “A” (0.1 mol/L): Pipette 0.83 mL of hydrochloric acid (37%) in a beaker and dilute to 100 mL with double distilled water. Preparation of hydrochloric acid solution “B” (0.01 mol/L): Take 10 mL of hydrochloric acid solution “A” and diluted to 100 mL with distilled water. The Tris–HCl buffer solution (0.1 mol/L) was prepared: 50 mL of Tris solution and 22.9 mL of hydrochloric acid “A” solution were mixed and transferred to a 100 mL volumetric flask with the pH of 8.2. Pyrogallol solution (3 × 10<ce:sup loc="post">−3</ce:sup> mol/L): Weigh 0.003783 g of pyrogallol added to 10 mL of hydrochloric acid “B” solution.</ce:para><ce:section-title id="st070">Preparation of compounds sample solution</ce:section-title><ce:para id="p0080" view="all">Weigh 1.0 mg of the compounds <ce:bold>1</ce:bold>–<ce:bold>3</ce:bold> dissolved in 10 mL of DMF solution, constant temperature ultrasound until completely dissolved, dubbed a 100 mg/L compound solution. Prepared the sample solution according to the six compositions in 
<ce:float-anchor refid="t0005"></ce:float-anchor>, mix it with a preheated 0.3 mL of 3 × 10<ce:sup loc="post">−3</ce:sup> mol/L pyrogallol at a constant temperature in a 25 °C water bath and pour into a 1 cm cell. Solution with a concentration of 0.01 mol/L hydrochloric acid as a blank solution, absorbance was measured at regular intervals and measured continuously for 3 min.</ce:para>
clean_text:
Preparation of the model compounds

[CoL(H2O)]⋅2H2O (1) Co(NO3)2⋅6H2O (0.0588g, 0.2mmol), L (0.0543g, 0.3mmol) and TMC (0.0265g, 0.1mmol) were dissolved in a mixed solution of 3mL EtOH, 1mL H2O and 1mL DMF. The pH of the solution was adjusted with dilute nitric acid to make the pH equal to 5. The solution is stirred for 2h at room temperature to give a pink suspension, which was transferred to a reaction pyrex vial and heated at 120°C for 5days. After cooled to room temperature, pink bulk crystals were obtained. Yield: 0.046g; 41% (based on Co (II)). Calc. for C8H10NO7Co: C, 32.59; H, 4.39; N, 4.81. Found: C, 32.64; H, 4.42; N, 4.76%. IR (KBr, cm-1): 3427, 3221, 3275, 2926, 2869, 1620, 1563, 1417, 1335, 1131, 1099, 1037, 783.

[CdL(H2O)]⋅H2O (2) Cd(NO3)2⋅6H2O (0.0588g, 0.2mmol), L (0.0543g, 0.3mmol) and TMC (Trimesoyl chloride) (0.0265g, 0.1mmol) were dissolved in a mixed solution of 4mL EtOH, 1mL H2O and 2mL DMF. To adjust the pH of the solution with dilute nitric acid so that pH equal to 4. Stirring at room temperature for 2h, a colorless transparent solution is obtained. Transfer the solution to a heat-resistant vial and heated at 140°C for 2days. After cooled to room temperature, colorless crystals were obtained. Yield: 0.054g; 39% (based on Cd (II)). Calc. for C8H9NO6Cd: C, 29.32; H, 2.69; N, 4.31. Found: C, 29.31; H, 2.75; N, 4.27%. IR (KBr, cm-1): 3336, 3216, 3139, 2920, 2861, 1617, 1549, 1476, 1383, 1153, 1066, 1014, 780.

[PbL] (3) PbSO4 (0.0304g, 0.1mmol) and L (0.0362g, 0.2mmol) were dissolved in a mixed solution of 2mL EtOH and 3mL DMA. Stirring at room temperature for 2h to give a white suspension, which was transferred to a Teflon-lined steel autoclave and heated at 120°C for 4days. After cooled to room temperature, colorless block crystals were obtained. Yield: 0.019g; 28% (based on Pb (II)). Calc. for C8H5NO4Pb: C, 24.82; H, 1.79; N, 3.65. Found: C, 24.85; H, 1.81; N, 3.62%. IR (KBr, cm-1): 3423, 3292, 3110, 2944, 2853, 1637, 1569, 1454, 1389, 1123, 1064, 1012, 778.

Antioxidant activity measurement

Solution preparation

Preparation of Tris solution (0.1mol/L): Weigh 1.2114g of tris-hydroxymethyl aminomethane (Tris) in a beaker and dilute to 100mL with double distilled water. Preparation of hydrochloric acid solution "A" (0.1mol/L): Pipette 0.83mL of hydrochloric acid (37%) in a beaker and dilute to 100mL with double distilled water. Preparation of hydrochloric acid solution "B" (0.01mol/L): Take 10mL of hydrochloric acid solution "A" and diluted to 100mL with distilled water. The Tris-HCl buffer solution (0.1mol/L) was prepared: 50mL of Tris solution and 22.9mL of hydrochloric acid "A" solution were mixed and transferred to a 100mL volumetric flask with the pH of 8.2. Pyrogallol solution (3×10-3 mol/L): Weigh 0.003783g of pyrogallol added to 10mL of hydrochloric acid "B" solution.

Preparation of compounds sample solution

Weigh 1.0mg of the compounds 1-3 dissolved in 10mL of DMF solution, constant temperature ultrasound until completely dissolved, dubbed a 100mg/L compound solution. Prepared the sample solution according to the six compositions in  , mix it with a preheated 0.3mL of 3×10-3mol/L pyrogallol at a constant temperature in a 25°C water bath and pour into a 1cm cell. Solution with a concentration of 0.01mol/L hydrochloric acid as a blank solution, absorbance was measured at regular intervals and measured continuously for 3min.
